Description:
Welcome to Async.social! This is a Mastodon instance created by Doisters, for Doisters. Not only current ones: anyone who worked with us in the past is welcome! That said, this server is not run or endorsed by Doist, only by individuals on their own free time.

Why async.social? We believe in the Doist values, and thrive with async communications.

Reporting issues and reaching moderators

You can DM or mention @schnouki@async.social, or email contact@async.social.

Creating an account

You'll need an invite to create an account. Current Doisters can ask on Twist channel; former Doisters should email contact@async.social to ask for one.

Tech details

This is currently a very small server ğŸ˜… Everything is running from a single VPS hosted by OVH, in the Gravelines (France) datacenter. Media files are hosted in OVH object storage, and proxied through the VPS to save on bandwidth costs ğŸ˜Š
Short: A Mastodon instance by Doisters, for Doisters.

Description:
This instance is devoted to creators of nude, erotic, and fetish art.

Models and photographers and others involved in the creation of such art are welcome on the server.

Instance Intent

Primary Intent - Nude, Fetish, and erotic art Secondary Intent - Photography of all other types. Please don't feel like you need to post your non-adult work elsewhere.
Tertiary Intent - Pornography. This instance is not primarily for pornography, but if that is part of your erotic work, then it can be posted. This is NOT an instance for sharing other folks pornography, but only your own you've created, if you want to share it. Please share as links, not uploads.

Reporting and Moderation

If someone is not following the rules, please report them with a short description of why.

My goal is to keep moderation as light as possible. Nude and Adult work is already so censored everywhere that I do NOT plan on moderating any work based on content.
Short: This server is dedicated to photographers and models who create adult, nude, erotic, and fetish art in photographs.

Description:
This is a queer-friendly general-purpose federated Mastodon instance. If you are working or thinking in the fields of architecture, civil engineering, or urban studies, please be welcome to create a profile and start tooting!

Real names and credentials are only recommended if you plan to use your account on this instance for networking purposes; they are absolutely not required.

Rules

  1. No racism, sexism / misogyny, ableism, anti-semitism / religious-based hate, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, or casteism.
  2. No incitement of violence or promotion of violent, white supremecist, incel, Holocaust denial or Nazi ideologies.
  3. No harassment, dogpiling, or doxing of other users.
  4. Sexually explicit or violent media must be marked as sensitive. Pornographic material may not be posted.
  5. No intentionally false or misleading information (this includes COVID-19 and vaccine misinformation).
  6. No spam.

Encouraged uses

  1. Brag about your publications.
  2. Share references and resources.
  3. Network with other academics.
  4. Put it on the last slide of your conference presentation.
  5. Recruit participants for academic surveys - formal, or even informal ones.
  6. Non-academic, "off-topic" stuff is allowed, but try to post this as Unlisted, not as Public.

Text and datamining

We are researchers and engineers, and you are very likely a researcher or engineer, too. And we want to support other researchers by allowing text and datamining in our instance. If you do not agree, please set the settings of your profile accordingly.

Research being conducted on this instance should follow ethical guidelines, should be approved by an ethics board if person related information is being dealt with, and should of course be published in compliance with open science principles.
Short: If you are working or thinking in the fields of architecture, civil engineering, or urban studies, please be welcome to lurk and toot with us on this queer-friendly, federated Mastodon instance!

Description:
This server was originally intended as a place for Catholic layfolk who had formed real relationships on other social media to have a home on Mastodon, however we are open to any and all Catholic, Catholic-adjacent, Catholic-interested, or none-of-the-above members.

Sister server to @religious.social which specifically hosts clergy, religious, and seminarians.

If you are interested in helping support this instance financially and are able to do so, please see our patreon page.
Short:
Adeste fidelis[sic], venite adoremus!

Intended as a place for Catholic laypeople from other sites to have a home on Mastodon, but open to anyone and everyone.

Description:
15-15-15.social es la comunidad virtual Mastodon de acceso restringido para personas suscriptoras, colaboradoras, simbiÃ³ticas y amigas de la Revista 15/15\15. VersiÃ³n beta.1.

Las cuentas pueden adquirirse en la tienda online de la AsociaciÃ³n Touda, editora de la revista, o en el web de la revista y necesitan, ademÃ¡s, un cÃ³digo de invitaciÃ³n.

Contacto

  • Equipo de gestiÃ³n: @revista.
  • Equipo de moderaciÃ³n: @revista, @moderatio.

Ayuda

Si eres nueva/a en Mastodon el equipo de gestiÃ³n y moderaciÃ³n de 15-15-15.social estarÃ¡ encantado de guiarte en tus primeros pasos por aquÃ­ y resolver tus dudas. No dudes en preguntarnos, pÃºblicamente o por privado.

IntroducciÃ³n al cÃ³digo de conducta

El CÃ³digo de Conducta de esta comunidad estÃ¡ formado por Recomendaciones (de cumplimiento recomendado pero no obligatorio) y Normas o Reglas del servidor (de cumplimiento obligatorio).

Aunque en la secciÃ³n inferior de Reglas del servidor encontrarÃ¡s una guÃ­a rÃ¡pida de las Normas bÃ¡sicas y mÃ¡s importantes, nos gustarÃ­a aquÃ­ aportar un poco mÃ¡s de informaciÃ³n acerca del funcionamiento y filosofÃ­a de esta comunidad.

Aunque creemos en la libertad de expresiÃ³n, tambiÃ©n creemos que el gobierno de los bienes y espacios comunes necesita basarse en unas mÃ­nimas reglas claras, justas y autocorregibles. Inicialmente hemos creado una serie de Normas y de Recomendaciones, que iremos adaptando y perfeccionando a medida que nuestra comunidad evolucione. Es importante que tengas en cuenta que la participaciÃ³n en la comunidad estÃ¡ supeditada a cumplir estas Normas, y que su incumplimiento puede significar medidas de moderaciÃ³n, incluyendo la expulsiÃ³n (cancelaciÃ³n de la cuenta de las personas infractoras).

Estamos abiertos a las sugerencias de toda la comunidad para ir perfeccionando tanto las Normas y Recomendaciones como su aplicaciÃ³n, y os animamos a escribirnos para ello a las cuentas que tenÃ©is indicadas mÃ¡s arriba.

Recomendaciones de conducta (v. beta.20220105)

  • Como usuarios de esta instancia, debÃ©is tener en cuenta que nuestro nombre de usuaria/o termina en @15-15-15.social y por tanto nuestros actos en el Fediverso representan en cierta forma a esta instancia y afectan a la imagen y buen nombre de la Revista 15/15\15, tanto dentro como fuera de esta pequeÃ±a aldea digital. De hecho, el mal comportamiento de un miembro de esa comunidad al interactuar con otras, o simplemente sus publicaciones que sean trasmitidas a otras confederadas con 15-15-15.social podrÃ­a ocasionar que la instancia en su conjunto fuese considerada non grata por otras y sus contenidos dejaran de trasmitirse en parte del Fediverso. Se recomienda encarecidamente, por tanto, el cuidado mutuo del conjunto de la comunidad y de la revista 15/15\15 con un comportamiento responsable.
  • Debido a esto, y en caso de que se reciban quejas de otras instancias, podrÃ­an irse aÃ±adiendo nuevas normas o convirtiendo recomendaciones opcionales en reglas obligatorias.
  • La mayorÃ­a de nosotras somos nuevas en el Fediverso, asÃ­ que rogamos paciencia y tambiÃ©n la ofreceremos. AquÃ­ estamos para aprender juntas otro modo mÃ¡s sano de relacionarnos online.
  • No obstante, si te sientes maltratado/a por algÃºn otro usuario, sufres microagresiones o cualquier otro tipo de comportamiento no recogido en las Normas, te animamos a que acudas a alguna de las personas del Equipo de ModeraciÃ³n.
  • Dado que nuestro equipo de moderaciÃ³n no conoce todos los idiomas del mundo, se ruega no publicar en idiomas que no conozca dicho equipo, que por el momento son: castellano, portuguÃ©s, inglÃ©s, catalÃ¡n, gallego, euskera, asturiano, occitano y esperanto.
  • En aras de una mayor accesibilidad recomendamos que se incluya una descripciÃ³n textual con cada imagen enviada y que se haga un uso moderado de emojis o sÃ­mbolos Unicode, lo cual facilitarÃ¡ el uso por parte de personas que utilizan lectores de pantalla.
  • Recomendamos que cada usuaria o usuario se automodere ya que no podemos ni tenemos interÃ©s en leer absolutamente todas y cada una de las publicaciones que se hagan en la instancia. No obstante, recordamos a todo el mundo que cualquier persona que nos lee, dentro o fuera de 15-15-15.social puede reportar cualquiera de nuestros contenido al equipo de moderaciÃ³n, es decir, que la propia comunidad vela por el buen comportamiento del conjunto.
  • Animamos a los usuarios a hacer uso de las opciones de bloqueo y silenciado (mute) para mejor controlar el contenido que aparece en sus timelines. Aunque la moderaciÃ³n se preocupa de bloquear a los peores abusones y de desconfederar a las instancias tÃ³xicas, hay que reconocer que la gente posee diferentes lÃ­mites y expectativas con respecto al Fediverso, asÃ­ que con dichas opciones se facilita una experiencia mÃ¡s personalizada.

  • Recomendaciones acerca de los avisos de contenido (content warning, CW): Dado que no tenemos ni la capacidad ni el interÃ©s de monitorizar todo el contenido que se publique en 15-15-15.social, animamos que los usuarios a que sean ellos mismos los que avisen mediante la funcionalidad propia de Mastodon, el CW, herramienta que permite en cada publicaciÃ³n advertir de que otros usuarios podrÃ­an considerarlo molesto. Hay ciertos tipos de contenidos que recomendamos que siempre lleven este aviso, y si otros usuarios notifican al equipo moderador que se ha publicado sin dicho CW, podrÃ­a ocasionar que se lo pusiesen los moderadores y que el autor o autora recibiese un aviso. Si esto se repite, podrÃ­a ocasionar que se le silenciase o suspendiese su cuenta o incluso, si fuese un caso grave, que ocasionase su expulsiÃ³n. Los contenidos que deberÃ­an contar siempre con un aviso de contenido (CW) son los siguientes:

    • ImÃ¡genes de cuerpos humanos desnudos y/o en actitudes sexuales.
    • ImÃ¡genes gore: sangre, heridas graves, tortura, asesinatos o intervenciones mÃ©dicas.
    • ImÃ¡genes relativas al uso de drogas.
    • Textos detallando actos sexuales.
    • Textos que puedan inducir al suicidio, a autolesiones, abuso, violaciÃ³n o agresiÃ³n sexual.
    • Textos que destripen argumentos de obras de ficciÃ³n (spoilers).
    • ImÃ¡genes o textos escatolÃ³gicos.
    • En general, cualquier imagen o texto ampliamente considerado repulsivo en las culturas actuales de los pueblos ibÃ©ricos.

  • Casos especiales de content warning:

    • Desnudez, sexo y drogas: Requerimos que estos temas incorporen avisos CW, entre otras cosas, porque su presencia como contenidos visibles en las timelines pÃºblicas pueden llevar a que otras instancias de Mastodon incluyan directa e irreversiblemente la nuestra en sus listas negras.
    • (Otros casos particulares serÃ¡n incluidos aquÃ­ a medida que los vayamos detectando.)

Denuncia

  • Al contrario que las plataformas privadas y centralizadas, la moderaciÃ³n en el Fediverso se intenta que rinda cuentas y sea lo mÃ¡s trasparente posible dentro de lo prÃ¡ctico. Por ello se listan arriba las personas que componen en todo momento el Equipo de ModeraciÃ³n.
  • Contamos con que todas las personas participantes en esta comunidad nos avisen de toda forma de comportamiento o contenido inaceptable al que podamos responder de una manera razonable. El Equipo de ModeraciÃ³n harÃ¡ todo lo posible para responder a estas denuncias en un plazo razonable.
  • Las denuncias que realizan usuarios de otras instancias del Fediverso acerca de los usuarios de 15-15-15.social son anÃ³nimas. Esto quiere decir que tan sÃ³lo sabremos de quÃ© instancia procede la denuncia pero no el usuario concreto que la ha hecho. Por tanto, no podremos comunicarnos con esa persona para responder a su denuncia, y tan sÃ³lo podremos actuar tomando medidas dentro de nuestra instancia. No obstante, sÃ­ que sabremos quiÃ©n denuncia desde 15-15-15.social.
  • Las denuncias que carezcan de una explicaciÃ³n son mucho mÃ¡s difÃ­ciles de procesar. Se agradece que incluyan enlaces, ejemplos, razones, explicaciones y cualquier otra informaciÃ³n. En concreto es muy importante que se nos especifique cuÃ¡l de las Reglas del servidor se ha vulnerado, por ejemplo. Debe entenderse que no podemos tomar medidas contra un usuario si no existe prueba de mal comportamiento.
  • Si la respuesta dada por el Equipo de ModeraciÃ³n no satisface a la persona denunciante, recomendamos que use las funciones de Bloquear o Silenciar contra la persona denunciada.

DesconfederaciÃ³n

  • Las personas gestoras de 15-15-15.social harÃ¡n todo lo posible para mantener esta instancia desligada de las partes mÃ¡s tÃ³xicas del Fediverso, intentando estar al dÃ­a del iniciativas confederales como #fediblock.
  • Aun asÃ­, para mantener la utilidad de esta comunidad, nuestro criterio general serÃ¡ no desconfederarnos de grandes instancias a causa de las malas acciones de una minorÃ­a de sus usuarios, porque de lo contrario estarÃ­amos privando a un gran nÃºmero de usuarios de esas instancias de la posibilidad de conocer y dialogar con nuestra propia comunidad de usuarios. Por tanto, tenderemos mÃ¡s a bloquear y silenciar cuentas concretas, a no ser que la instancia en sÃ­ no tenga arreglo. Haremos lo posible por mantener lÃ­neas abiertas de comunicaciÃ³n con otras personas administradoras, pasarles denuncias acerca de sus usuarios cuando lo consideremos necesario o apropiado.

RevisiÃ³n de recomendaciones y normas

  • Las personas a cargo de la instancia podrÃ¡n decidir en cualquier momento la modificaciÃ³n de las normas y recomendaciones vigentes.
  • Sobre todo durante los primeros meses de funcionamiento, o a medida que el trÃ¡fico y el nÃºmero de usuarios crezca, es previsible que las normas vayan variando con cierta frecuencia, perfeccionÃ¡ndose y detallÃ¡ndose progresivamente.
  • La entrada en vigor de cualquier cambio deberÃ¡ ser notificado a los miembros de la comunidad, los cuales podrÃ¡n optar entre aceptarlo o darse de baja de la misma si no lo aceptan, con derecho a recuperar la parte no disfrutada de su cuota anual, en su caso.
  • Los propios miembros podrÃ¡n solicitar en cualquier momento la modificaciÃ³n de cualquiera de las normas. Para ello cursarÃ¡n peticiÃ³n expresa a la persona gestora de la comunidad.

Desacuerdo con la moderaciÃ³n

  • Los moderadores podrÃ¡n ser reprobados por realizar inadecuadamente su labor, si asÃ­ lo solicitan los miembros de la comunidad a la persona a cargo de la GestiÃ³n de la instancia, que podrÃ­a, previa consulta al Consejo Director del Instituto Resiliencia (CDIR), tomar la decisiÃ³n de sustituir a la persona reprobada. La persona gestora serÃ¡ la encargada de recibir y gestionar las quejas y solicitudes de aclaraciÃ³n acerca de las normas y la moderaciÃ³n.
  • Cualquier divergencia en torno a la interpretaciÃ³n y aplicaciÃ³n de las normas de la comunidad, serÃ¡ remitida al CDIR, que serÃ¡ el Ã³rgano capacitado para tomar las decisiones al respecto, que serÃ¡n inapelables.

Advertencias

  • Las publicaciones que incumplan las Normas o las Recomendaciones podrÃ¡n ser denunciadas por cualquier miembro de la comunidad, lo cual podrÃ¡ causar su retirada por parte de las personas moderadoras. Estas podrÃ¡n, asÃ­ mismo, enviar al usuario o usuaria autor de dicha publicaciÃ³n un aviso o advertencia. El hecho de que un mismo usuario reciba advertencias repetidas podrÃ¡ llevar a que su cuenta sea suspendida o sea sometido a un proceso de expulsiÃ³n.

Causas de expulsiÃ³n

  • El usuario o usuaria que incumpla cualquiera de las Reglas del servidor listadas a continuaciÃ³n o sea reincidentes en un comportamiento que contravenga las recomendaciones verÃ¡ el publicaciÃ³n en cuestiÃ³n borrada y serÃ¡ sometidos a un procedimiento express de expulsiÃ³n. RecibirÃ¡ una comunicaciÃ³n en su cuenta y en su correo electrÃ³nico asociado, donde serÃ¡ informado/a de los motivos para que presente alegaciones ante el equipo moderador en menos de 24 horas. Si no se presentan o no son consideradas convincentes, el usuario o usuaria serÃ¡ borrado/a del sistema.
  • La administraciÃ³n de la comunidad facilitarÃ¡ a las personas expulsadas su migraciÃ³n a otras instancias.

Reglas del servidor (v. 20230113)

Description:
Art by our very own @Monchi

Please review the rules before making an account and posting!
Also please read the Policy page at https://rodent.life/privacy-policy if you are thinking about applying. Our timelines are public, so you don't need a login to view. This instance is largely English-speaking with federation to English and Japanese speaking instances. Registration is currently invite-only.

About rodent.life

rodent.life (informally abbreviated RoLi) is a furry Fediverse community running on Mastodon. As a furry community there is an appreciation for art and artists and we do what we can to support them and provide a space to openly create and network. There may be posts in our timelines from LGBTQIA+ focused instances and from tech industry focused instances where some of our interests overlap. But this is primarily a space for furries.

In order to maintain an inclusive and welcoming space, we do have to set some ground rules. As such, this is not a â€œfree speechâ€ instance, where anything goes. We choose to federate as openly as possible within the restrictions of the rules and moderation expectations set below.

Hashtags

Like other social media platforms, Mastodon makes use of hashtags. Feel free to tag in English, Japanese, or both. (ex. #rabbit #å… #ã†ã•ã ) This instance can search either. Please do use tags though, especially with images. They are used to help people that want to find your content and to use in filters for people that do not want to see it.

Content Warnings

Unlike other social media platforms, Mastodon makes use of a feature called a Content Warning (CW). This feature effectively acts as a â€œspoilerâ€ for the content of your post. The only text presented is the set of tags that the poster chooses to describe the content with. This allows you to give your audience the chance to consent to the content that you are choosing to reveal to them. Some of the rules require the use of Content Warnings, so please familiarize yourself with them. (This instance also has a pretty high character limit, and using a CW with the subject of a longer post should be done to keep the timelines clean.)

To other instance admins and whoever is curious about the moderation

Users here may post media that is not acceptable on other instances (typically artwork, as explicit photography is not allowed). If a post from originating from rodent.life contains explicit media, it is required to have a CW and be adequately censored. I encourage the use of tags regardless. If you admin/moderate an instance that resides in a location where such imagery is not legal, or have users that may be sensitive to such content, I recommend at a minimum rejecting media from rodent.life .

If another instance sends uncensored explicit media, this instance will reject media from it, regardless of whether or not there is a CW. If users from another instance are filling the Federated timelime with hate speech of any kind, and the Rules of that server disallow it, this instance will suspend the user (and likely attempt to reach out to the admin of the remote instance). If that happens and the Rules of another server allow such behaviour, this instance will simply suspend that instance outright.

If users in another instance are in some way in violation of the other Rules of this server (AI art posted, bot accounts, non-furry accounts, etc.) such users will likely be limited at admin discretion. If this happens a lot, or an instance seems to exist entirely for a purpose that breaks a Rule here (caters almost exclusively to bots, exists to promote a corporate account/brand), that instance will likely be suspended at admin discretion.

If the admin/moderation team of another instance publicly attempts to cause reputational harm (FediBlock posts, blocklist public messages, etc.) to rodent.life or its administration, it will be grounds for suspension of the remote instance.

Funding

At this time, this instance is funded by an individual. It does not cost enough to justify asking for more. I would encourage spending that money within the community, possibly helping out a lesser-known artist that needs it more than I do.

Custom Emoji

Nearly all of these icons have a requirement that they are used respectfully, and not to disparage the associated product. Please be respectful when using these custom emoji, and feel free to read the specific guidelines if there are any questions. Please report any violations on rodent.life to admin@rabbitpa.ws or open a report for the user/post on rodent.life .

Inkbunny - Emoji Code :inkbunny: - rodent.life received approval to use the logo for a custom emoji from the staff at inkbunny.net on April 27th 2023, provided we get permission from the artist, Shiuk, as well. Shiuk gave permission for rodent.life to use the art for an emoji on April 28th 2023.

Mastodon - Emoji Code :mastodon: - Using the image from the brand toolkit (as of April 25th 2023). https://joinmastodon.org/branding

Misskey - Emoji Code :misskey: - CC BY-NC-SA Licensed from misskey-hub.net (last verified April 25th 2023). https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.0/

Pixiv - Emoji Code :pixiv: - Using per the guidelines on their website under the section â€œGuidelines on registered trademarkâ€ (reviewed via Apple translation software on April 25th 2023). https://policies.pixiv.net/en.html

Twitter - Emoji Code :twitter: - Using per the â€œsocial iconsâ€ (pg 7) their branding trademark guidelines as of October 2020 (last verified April 25th 2023). https://about.twitter.com/content/dam/about-twitter/en/brand-toolkit/downloads/twitter-external-brand-guidelines-01272021.pdf

Hanshi is distributed across servers located in Amsterdam, Japan, and New York. User content is stored in a Mastodon database, with the additional step of removing your access IP address for privacy. Considering privacy protection, we recommend that users register using a disposable email address.

Hanshi operates on a long-term basis. Users will have the ability to export all their personal data and have the option to migrate to another site before the closure.

If you encounter any content that you find disturbing, do not hesitate to use report feature. Hanshi's operational team will take appropriate actions to address the issue. Welcome to any.dev

Our instance motto is simple:

Letâ€™s leave the internet a little better than we found it. And donâ€™t be a jerk.

Specifically, we donâ€™t allow:

  • Any form of hate or the advocacy of hate, including but not limited to racism, sexism, misogyny, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, nationalism, classism, ableism, and antisemitism.
  • Mean-spirited personal attacks, intentional unkindness, or doxxing. That doesnâ€™t mean you have to be polite: in fact, members are encouraged to call out bad behavior. But again, donâ€™t be a jerk.
  • Intentional misinformation.
  • Pornographic images/videos/etc. (This is for practical reasons: weâ€™re not set up to handle the age verification and moderation burden associated with this kind of content).
  • Shilling crypto, gambling, scams, MLMs, etc.
  • Passing off someone elseâ€™s work as your own or non-comedic impersonation.
  • Content that has little-to-no value and is designed purely for engagement (see the reddit self-promotion guidelines for a sense of where to draw this line).

Moderation decisions will be made based on the spirit of these rules, not the letter. Extreme, blatant violations may result in an immediate ban. Most violations will be handled privately, and members will have the option to either remove/modify their post or migrate to another instance. If you are acting in good faith, weâ€™ll do our best to help you migrate seamlessly to another instance that better matches your values without any disruption to your access to the fediverse.
Short: Letâ€™s leave the internet a little better than we found it. And donâ€™t be a jerk.

Lettre et esprit de la loi

Les rÃ¨gles de lâ€™instance

  1. Aucune discrimination ni dÃ©nigrement ne sera tolÃ©rÃ© concernant les informations qui pourraient Ãªtre divulguÃ©es par les utilisateurices telles que : appartenance ou non Ã  une prÃ©tendue race, appartenance ou non Ã  une nation, sexe, identitÃ© de genre, orientation sexuelle, grossesse, handicap, origine, religion, opinions politiques, opinions philosophiques, situation familiale, caractÃ©ristiques gÃ©nÃ©tiques, mÅ“urs, lieu de rÃ©sidence, ethnicitÃ© ou non, perte dâ€™autonomie, capacitÃ© Ã  parler une langue Ã©trangÃ¨re, vulnÃ©rabilitÃ© due Ã  la situation Ã©conomique, apparence physique, Ã¢ge, Ã©tat de santÃ©. Cela signifie que les messages racistes, sexistes, homophobes, transphobes, validistes etc. sont interdits.
  2. Tout comportement de harcÃ¨lement moral, dâ€™atteinte Ã  la vie privÃ©e, de diffamation, dâ€™injures, de menaces seront systÃ©matiquement sanctionnÃ©s par un bannissement.
  3. Les mÃ©dias sociaux sont considÃ©rÃ©s comme des espaces publics. Par consÃ©quent, la libertÃ© dâ€™expression, le droit Ã  lâ€™image et le droit dâ€™auteur sâ€™appliquent. Vous devez donc Ãªtre conscient que le contenu que vous avez publiÃ© relÃ¨ve de votre responsabilitÃ©. NÃ©anmoins, lâ€™hÃ©bergeur peut Ãªtre tenu pour responsable si des contenus illicites ont Ã©tÃ© diffusÃ©s, quâ€™il en avait connaissance, mais quâ€™il nâ€™a rien fait pour les retirer dans les 24 heures. Câ€™est pourquoi tout contenu illicite sera immÃ©diatement retirÃ©. Cela inclut notamment la pornographie enfantine (y compris dessinÃ©e), lâ€™incitation Ã  la haine, lâ€™apologie des crimes de guerre, des crimes contre lâ€™humanitÃ©, des crimes de rÃ©duction en esclavage, la nÃ©gation de lâ€™existence des crimes contre lâ€™humanitÃ©, lâ€™apologie publique des actes de terrorisme.
  4. Le contenu pornographique nâ€™est pas autorisÃ© sur cette instance, car nous nâ€™avons pas la capacitÃ© dâ€™en assurer la provenance lÃ©gale et Ã©thique.
  5. Les comptes parodiques sont acceptÃ©s mais doivent mentionner explicitement quâ€™ils sont parodiques dans leur description.
  6. Les bots sont autorisÃ©s. Cependant, les bots qui sâ€™immiscent dans les timelines publiques peuvent Ãªtre rÃ©duits au silence sâ€™ils abusent (flood, spam, etc.). Les robots qui mentionnent trop souvent des utilisateurices sans leur consentement peuvent Ãªtre suspendus.

Ce qui suit ne sont pas des rÃ¨gles Ã  proprement parler, mais des conseils pour une utilisation apaisÃ©e de cette instance :

  • Il nâ€™y a pas de contrainte particuliÃ¨re concernant lâ€™usage du Content Warning (CW) mais vous Ãªtes invitÃ©â‹…es Ã  les utiliser pour les messages/images explicitement sexuels ou violents.
  • Gardez Ã  lâ€™esprit que sur dâ€™autres instances il existe dâ€™autres pratiques. Il relÃ¨ve de votre choix personnel de les suivre (ou pas).
  • Il est apprÃ©ciÃ© que les images soient accompagnÃ©es de descriptions permettant aux personnes ayant un handicap visuel de comprendre leur contenu.

  • Si vous faites un thread, vous pouvez commencer par un message listÃ©, suivi par des messages non-listÃ©s en rÃ©ponse. Cela Ã©vite que la timeline locale soit accaparÃ©e par une seule personne.
  • Si vous Ãªtes une personne particuliÃ¨rement sensible ou phobique, nous vous conseillons dâ€™Ã©viter de consulter les timelines publiques de cette instance afin de ne pas risquer dâ€™Ãªtre confrontÃ©e Ã  des contenus non sollicitÃ©s.
  • Nâ€™oubliez pas que si vous nâ€™aimez pas les contenus dâ€™une autre personne, vous pouvez masquer temporairement ou dÃ©finitivement un compte, ou le bloquer, ou mÃªme bloquer une instance entiÃ¨re. Vous pouvez Ã©galement mettre en place des filtres pour masquer les contenus qui vous dÃ©rangent, voire mÃªme changer dâ€™instance.

Description:
We set up this server to accomodate ppl who can't stand other "social" media sites, either because the sites try to have too many functions, or because of abusive behavior by other users. We have rather strict rules to protect the neuro-diverse and gender-diverse communities. Abusive behavior is not tolerated, and we will not hesitate to close an account that has broken our rules. All languages are welcome.

Here are some guides about using this site

Caleida Admin

Description: This Mastodon server is the official server for the sub-Reddit r/selfhosted. We welcome all users who adhere to our rules and specifically those who are into self-hosting. You can also chat with fellow self-hosters on Discord and Matrix.

Description:
This is a little Mastodon server for PKU people!

The NSPKU have a great page on information about PKU if you are a bit confused as to what it is. In a nutshell you are born with it, and in most countries you find out early on in birth.

Please consider supporting the NSPKU. They are a fantastic UK charity and have done wonders for the NSPKU.

This server/mastodon instance is not owned or controlled by them, but by someone who himself has Phenylketonuria.

Description:
Intro

We are a community. Everyone in this space brings their own experiences and perspectives, and this intersection of personal histories can be messy. Though there is no way to create a truly universal 'safe space', we intentionally cultivate an atmosphere of mutual respect, understanding, and kindness here. We are all individuals doing our best, making our way through life together.

Code of Conduct

Posts or users will be removed if found to be in violation of the CoC, and repeated violations will result in an account limitation or suspension.

  1. No promoting NFTs, cryptocurrencies, or other scams.

  2. Each IP address is currently allowed 2 active accounts by default. If you have a redirected old account for a name change it will not count towards your active account limit. If you are in a situation where your IP will be the same as someone elseâ€™s, please note that when signing up.

  3. Name changes are restricted to twice a year. If you are requesting a name change, please put in the account creation reason field that you are requesting a name change and what your current account name is.

  4. This is not a server for posting AI-generated content or for creating a bot account, there are many other, better servers to host your bot or if you are interested in AI-generated content.

  5. Content warning is not a general requirement aside from gore, graphic violence, and sexualized nudity. These topics are not allowed on the public timelines (server or federated) without being marked as sensitive and/or a content warning. Posts may be removed if found in violation, and repeatedly violating this rule may result in an account limitation or suspension.

  6. If you're on here you're representing our server in the broader fediverse, so be mindful of your interactions with people off the server as well. Users that are reported for spamming, trolling, or otherwise breaking the rules on this server by other servers in any way may face account suspension or ban.

Moderation Team

@aasyla @Elsanperi @Mewsly @seven @void

Guides

Mastodon

For the moment we recommend you take a look at fedi.tips for some useful guides on how to use Mastodon in general.

Hometown

Hometown has some additional features that we will add additional guides for in the future:

  • Local-only posting
  • Opting out of a public-post RSS feed

Credits

None yet, but we'll add credit for resources used here in the future.

Privacy & Security

While we are not looking to grow this instance, we are working toward following the Mastodon Covenant

  • We are implementing moderation policies against racism, sexism, homophobia, and transphobia.
  • We have daily backups of user data in place.
  • Currently only one user has access to the server infrastructure but we will be working on training others to serve in emergencies.
  • We are committed to 3 months advanced warning in the case the server is being shut down to allow people time to export data and migrate to a new server.

Privacy Policy

DMCA

Illusory Ink respects the intellectual property rights of others. Per the DMCA, we will respond expeditiously to claims of copyright infringement on the Site if submitted to our Copyright Agent as described below. Upon receipt of a notice alleging copyright infringement, We will take whatever action it deems appropriate within its sole discretion, including removal of the allegedly infringing materials and termination of access for repeat infringers of copyright protected content.

If you believe that your intellectual property rights have been violated by us or by a third party who has uploaded materials to our website, please provide the following information to the designated Copyright Agent listed below:

  • A description of the copyrighted work or other intellectual property that you claim has been infringed;
  • A description of where the material that you claim is infringing is located on the Site;
  • An address, telephone number, and email address where we can contact you and, if different, an email address where the alleged infringing party, if not we, can contact you;
  • A statement that you have a good-faith belief that the use is not authorized by the copyright owner or other intellectual property rights owner, by its agent, or by law;
  • A statement by you under penalty of perjury that the information in your notice is accurate and that you are the copyright or intellectual property owner or are authorized to act on the owner's behalf;
  • Your electronic or physical signature.

Illusory Ink may request additional information before removing any allegedly infringing material. In the event we remove the allegedly infringing materials, we will immediately notify the person responsible for posting such materials that we removed or disabled access to the materials. We may also provide the responsible person with your email address so that the person may respond to your allegations.

Pursuant to 17 U.S.C. 512(c). Illusory Ink's designated Copyright Agent is:

Jonathan Bailey
CopyByte
3157 Gentilly Blvd Suite # 2254
New Orleans, LA 70122
Phone: 1-504-356-4555
Email: illusoryink-dmca@copybyte.com
Short: A private server trying out hometown for myself and friends.

Description:
Goonj is an open, privacy conscious social network. Anyone can join and use it to connect with friends and family.

Open

Goonj is open for everyone to join, but hate speech of any kind is prohibited. Goonj can be joined through any device through our web application. Goonj is open source and based on the popular Mastodon social network.

Privacy Conscious

Users can seamlessly download their entire account data and delete their accounts any time they want. No private information like Real Name, Date of Birth etc. is required to join Goonj. Goonj provides easy control to share your content with a limited audience or to a wider audience as required.

Code of Conduct

Try to be a good neighbour to everyone in the community. Please avoid all behaviour which can be considered spamming, scamming, ponography, NSFW content, advocacy of violence, ethnic/racial/homophobic slurs, harassment, or any other content/activity deemed against the law. Offending content will need to be removed by the user, and repeat offenders will be banned from the community.

We strive to be "work-friendly", so if you post anything that's allowable under our policy but may reasonably be considered objectionable, please use a CW (content warning) to tag it as such.

Moderation activities will be as transparent as possible, with rationales for each action. The community will have the opportunity to review and give input on actions, and the moderation team will be responsive to that.

* Nudity exceptions - the following are okay: Nudity in photos of paintings and sculptures; Breastfeeding (with content warning); Nudity in photos of political expression or significance (with content warning). Examples that don't qualify as exceptions: Nudity in digital art; Nudity with political text simply added to it; etc.


FAQ

How to invite people to follow you

Go to Invites. Check Invite to follow your account, and generate a link. People who sign up through the invite will automatically follow you!

How to enable/disable email notifications

Go to Notifications

Recommended: Enable all notifications to start with; then, if there are any you find you don't like, disable them.

How to export all your data

Go to Data export
Short: Goonj is an open, privacy conscious social network.
A server managed and hosted by Oursky.com for employees, alumni and friends.

Description:
There is a private Mastodon instance setup for the who's who in the web world. Most of us are not cool enough to be invited to that server. I thought it would be nice to have a server where all web designers and developers could join and network. If you are build websites as a freelancer, indie web apps or a developer for a company, this is a great place for you.

Funding

Running this server costs time and money. All donations are welcome and will be put back into making this server better for all of us.

Reporting and moderation

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behaviour, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment.

We usually handle reports within 72 hours. Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to a punitive action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first time offenses, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offenses.
Short: Calling all Web Designers and Developers. This is a Mastodon instance for us all to connect and chat about the amazing websites and web apps we are building.

Description:
Instance

This community is a safe space for anyone interested in IT, software development, cloud-native, DevOps practices, and open-source principles, built around the Italian podcast Continuous Delivery. Here, you can connect with other listeners, share your thoughts and insights, and join the conversation surrounding the latest developments in the software industry.

Whether you're a seasoned practitioner or just getting started in the field, this instance is the perfect place to connect with others, learn from the experts, and stay up-to-date on the latest trends and best practices in software delivery.

Support

Our Mastodon instance is powered by SparkFabrik, a leading technology company with a focus on cloud native and DevOps practices. With years of expertise in the field, SparkFabrik is committed to supporting and promoting the "Continuous Delivery" podcast and its mission to educate and inform the software development community.

Note

Please note that SparkFabrik does not take responsibility for the content published by users on this Mastodon instance. Users are solely responsible for the accuracy, legality, and reliability of the information they share on this platform. SparkFabrik does not endorse or guarantee the accuracy of any user-generated content and will not be held liable for any damages or losses resulting from the use of information shared by users on this Mastodon instance.
Short: A Mastodon instance built around the Continuous Delivery podcast and supported by SparkFabrik.

Description: Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

STOAT.ZONE is a private server for a small group of existing collaborators with prior agreements about what and how to post, our responsibilities to each other, &c. By sharing the costs of running our own server, we are creating a small, collective online resource for ourselves.

We really recommend this model of participation in the Mastodon ecosystem. Our server is hosted at Masto.host, which is fully managed and couldn't be easier. If large servers aren't for you, try starting one!
Short: The hottest lineage.

Description:
Welcome to MOULE WORLD - A worldbuilding project soundtracking a chaotic world and the cartoon animal characters in it with multi-genre electronic music! Hold on for dear life and Enjoy the Ride!

Now on the Fediverse thanks to Mastodon, you can interact with us from the server(s) you're signed up on! If you're completely new to Mastodon and/or the Fediverse, I highly recommend reading fedi.tips to get started!

This server is hosted on mastodon.moule.world, but thanks to a domain trick our usernames all end with "@moule.world". When viewing our posts, it's best to open mastodon.moule.world in a separate tab to get the full threads and find even more MOULE WORLD posts not federated to your instance!

History of MOULE and MOULE WORLD

I've been producing multi-genre electronic music and digital art since 2015, and after overcoming self-doubt, only began sharing them online from January 1, 2020, starting out on Bandcamp and Twitter.

I started by releasing generic abstract artwork and simple tunes to Bandcamp, before branching out to other services like Spotify etc, gradually gaining the confidence to share my more unique music and cartoony art style.

In mid-2021, the animal characters from my artworks began getting their own names, personalities, and backstories, and my music began soundtracking a world I now call "MOULE WORLD".

In 2022, during chaotic changes at Twitter, I joined the Fediverse! I started my first account on mas.to, then I bought the domain name "moule.world", and taught myself web-hosting and how to set-up this server while banned from Twitter for posting about Elon Musk's jet.

In 2023, I migrated from mas.to to here, and a few months later made my final Tweet after Twitter rebranded to "X". Seven months later in 2024, I deleted my Twitter account, and host a publicly-available archive of my Tweets here.

This is my new "main" social platform and I'm so happy I can continue sharing my world here on the Fediverse!

For the latest MOULE updates, visit MOULE.WORLD!

Acknowledgement of Countries

I create MOULE WORLD's music, artwork, and operate this server on Whadjuk Nyoongar Boodjar, the lands of the Whadjuk Nyoongar people, in south-western Australia.

In addition, this Mastodon server is hosted on Lenapehoking, the lands of the Lenape people, where Newark and New York City are in the USA.

I pay my respects to all Indigenous cultures past, present, and emerging, and to the lands on which I operate.

Code of Conduct

Everything I do in this Mastodon instance and my conduct and that of the many characters in it, are part of my own, self-funded solo project hosted in the cloud, with no sign-ups and thus no terms of service. Instead, I have my own Code of Conduct I'll hold myself accountable to, in line with the Mastodon Server Covenant, outlined in the below Server Rules.

The Code of Conduct will also be used as a basis for choosing whether or not MOULE WORLD will federate with other servers. There's 2,500+ instances blocked â€“ half of them being the usual suspects blocked before even opening my server up to the Fediverse.

If you believe I or other MOULE WORLD characters have broken the below Server Rules or would like to dispute a block, feel free to privately message me on the Fediverse (@MOULE@MOULE.WORLD), report the post, or email me, and I'll get back to you as soon as I can!

Credits

â€¢ Eugen Rochko et al. â€“ for making the Mastodon software.

â€¢ Roni Laukkarinen â€“ for creating the Mastodon Bird UI, which this server uses with some changes to its colours and logo.

â€¢ Åukasz WÃ³jcik â€“ for providing an example code of conduct which helped me write the below Server Rules which I hold myself and all MOULE WORLD characters accountable to.

â€¢ The numerous contributors who built all the Ruby gems, NPM dependencies, and all the programming for Mastodon and ActivityPub.

â€¢ And of course, a HUGE thank you to everyone who supports my music, art, or otherwise interacts with MOULE WORLD. Thank you so much for visiting, and Enjoy the Ride!

(Last updated: March 8, 2024)
Short: Soundtracking the MOULE WORLD and its animal characters with multi-genre electronic music!

Description:
f slurs dot gay is an intentionally small fediverse instance, for f slurs and other fruits.

If you think this might be a place for you, please read the server rules, and apply for an account!

As a note, this may not be the most stable instance, I (@sleep) am running this on my lonesome in my free time. While I will not fully promise to follow the Mastodon Server Covenant, I do promise to provide all users with as much time and support as I can to allow them to move to a new instance should I ever decide it's time to turn it off.

Additionally, while I cannot ensure immediate moderation (the instance is currently only run by me), I will attempt to respond to any reports promptly (but please do give me a couple days).

I also promise to do my best to keep this a bigotry free place, as free from transphobia, racism, homophobia, sexism, and any other forms of bigotry I cannot think of while I'm typing this up.

While I do not currently have a full-scale document for outlining my ethos for running this instance (I would like to write that with the community, should one ever start existing here), Darius Kazemi's Run your own social aligns very closely with my own views on running and building a community. I also think any code of conduct that's ever written for f slurs dot gay will end up being very similar to the woof.group code of conduct.

If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to @sleep!

The default UI theme is Tangerine UI, with some minor modifications.
Short: f slurs dot gay is a fediverse instance for everyone's favorite f slurs

Description:
About the Name

CONNECTOPUS /kuh-nektÉ™pÊŠs/

When we (Octo and John V) had the idea for Connectopus, the friendly octopus connecting you with your community, back in 2016, the landscape seemed prime for a new social platform. We followed many creatives, performers, photographers, and others who had posts constantly reported while hateful and anti-science stuff was left up. After much thinking and when development stalled the idea was scrapped. Now seeing the need for more support to the distributed platforms, the time seemed right to bring the domain back as a Mastodon instance and turn development efforts towards contributing to the open source ActivityPub based ecosystem. Like a friendly octopoda, riding on the back of a proboscidean, here's our instance!

Moderation Team

Fearless leader: @Octo (she/her)
Tech nerd: @johnvenr (he/him)

You should follow @technuition (not a personal account - used for administrative purposes) to see real-time posts for information regarding the server. Also keep an eye out for announcements that appear at the top of your â€œHomeâ€ timeline under the little trumpet icon.

About the Server and Funding

Thanks to Octo, the server this instance runs on is administered and funded by Technuition, a woman owned small business providing IT, technology, and software development services.

If you are able, head to https://patreon.com/johnvenr to pledge your financial support to keeping the instance running - sadly servers and storage cost money and we don't have unlimited financial resources.

Trustees

Special thanks to our â€œTrusteeâ€ level Patreon supporters: @CAman

About the Instance

This Mastodon instance welcomes members of the LGBTQIA+ community and allies. Hate speech and bullying wonâ€™t be tolerated. Just because you're behind a computer screen doesnâ€™t mean that you donâ€™t need to respect other people.

We intend for this instance and its moderation to run smoothly. We may or may not notify you when a report you've made has led to a punitive action. Not all punitive actions will be visible to users. First time offenders may have their offensive content removed, but repeat offenders may experience harsher measures up to and including the removal of access to this instance.

This group will not tolerate racism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, Nazis, or hate speech which will be determined at the sole discretion of the moderators. All defamatory, abusive, bigoted, threatening, offensive, or illegal material (particularly things illegal in the US as that is where our server is hosted) is strictly prohibited. If you feel that you are experiencing bullying or harassment of any kind please report it to the moderators - report the post or email the administrator account.

We want our community to be able to discuss topics that may be of interest to others but triggering to some. Consent is important in all matters. Some may choose not to see your material so please label things accordingly. If you feel the topic you want to discuss may harm someone who comes across it, please mark it with a content warning (CW). The â€œCWâ€ button or shield bubble icon with the â€œ!â€ inside of it. This feature will hide an image that has sensitive content behind a warning banner that can be clicked on to access the material. Sensitive and triggering content may include but not limited to the following: NSFW (we will get into more detail about this later), images with direct eye contact, abuse, wars, graphic images, and mental or physical disorders. Be respectful that everyone has their own experiences and may be triggered by something that you are not triggered by so ensure that you have the proper labels on material. The bottom line is if someone in good faith asks you to CW your post, then kindly use the three dots and select "Delete and re-draft" but this time post with the proper CW.

Since this server is hosted in the US and as a result of (misogynistic) social expectations here, letâ€™s be safe and put all toplessness regardless of gender presentation behind a CW. Any erotic content must also include a CW. If youâ€™re looking to trade your favorite explicit adult content, this is not the place for that. There are other venues for that type of posting.

Further, NSFW is content that you wouldnâ€™t want your manager to see or things you wouldnâ€™t be caught sending to a minor. Minors may be able to see publicly posted non-CW content, so be mindful that your public posts might make their way in front of younger eyes. Please clearly mark explicit content with a CW.

Be respectful of others. We want this to be a welcoming place for people to share and discuss topics that mean something to them. Please try to discuss in good faith. Bad faith arguments are never beneficial. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users or moderators will not be tolerated. If one user has asked for another user to stop certain actions this can be considered harassment and will be addressed accordingly.

Posting or sharing someone's personal information, private data or demographic information without their permission is strictly prohibited.

Some of us make a living by advertising our products and services; however, weâ€™d like to avoid having the instance devolve into a stream of advertisements or requests for money. We also understand that sometimes people need help and mutual aid requests are going to be necessary. If you are unsure if your post is going against this rule, please reach out to the administrator.

If you wonder why we mention actual Nazis this gives a pretty good idea: https://www.upworthy.com/bartender-explains-why-he-swiftly-kicks-nazis-out-of-his-punk-bar-even-if-theyre-not-bothering-anyone

tldr; Karl Popper in 1945:"Unlimited tolerance must lead to the disappearance of tolerance. If we extend unlimited tolerance even to those who are intolerant, if we are not prepared to defend a tolerant society against the onslaught of the intolerant, then the tolerant will be destroyed, and tolerance with them." Bartender at punk bar: "you have to ignore their (the Nazis) reasonable arguments because their end goal is to be terrible, awful people."

Summary of the Rules

  1. This group will not tolerate racism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, Nazis, or hate speech which will be determined at the sole discretion of the moderators.
  2. If you are experiencing hate speech or harassment, please report it to the moderators.
  3. Consent matters. Use content warnings (CW) often and always where required (see details above)
  4. NSFW content is allowed behind CW banners
  5. Be respectful of others
  6. No harassment or stalking
  7. No posting or sharing another user's personal information
  8. No excessive posting of advertisements or requesting for cash (see details above)

Note on Privacy

Posts made public are replicated on servers across the fediverse. Your content may spread further than you expect.

"Direct messages" (which are @ only posts) are not end-to-end encrypted and sit on servers of the users mentioned unencrypted. If you need secure truly private conversations we suggest you DM a means to communicate using a more secure channel outside of the fediverse.

This is the breakdown of known stored information and who can see it:

  • username
    • used to identify you here on the server and with @connectop.us identifies you in the fediverse
    • the public, moderators, and technical admins
  • email address
    • used to send you notifications, restore access to your account, identify you for login
    • moderators and technical admins
  • ip address (public facing ip only)
    • used by the server to prevent flooding attacks, may appear in mastodon logs for up to 2 days, may appear in web server logs for 7 or more days depending on the amount of server traffic
    • accessible to the moderators (for up to 2 days) and technical admins
  • date/time joined
    • used to show on your profile
    • the public, moderators, and technical admins
  • date/time of last activity
    • used for maintaining sessions, used for server statistics
    • moderators and technical admins
  • interface language
    • used for server statistics
    • moderators and technical admins
  • password
    • used to log you into the system, stored hashed in the mastodon database
    • the hash could be accessed by admins but there is no reason they would do so
  • 2FA status
    • used to log you into the system, status (enabled/disabled) for user administration
    • moderators and technical admins
  • number of posts
    • used for system statistics, used for system administration, shown on profile
    • the public, moderators and technical admins
  • size in bytes of media attachements
    • used for system statistics, used for system administration
    • moderators and technical admins
  • number of followers
    • used for system statistics, used for system administration, shown on profile
    • the public, moderators, and technical admins
  • number of users following you
    • shown on profile
    • the public, moderators, and technical admins
  • number of time you made post or user moderation reports
    • used for system statistics, used for system administration
    • moderators and technical admins
  • number of times other users reported you or your posts for moderation
    • used for system statistics, used for system administration
    • moderators and technical admins
  • profile text and links
    • used to show on your profile
    • the public, moderators, and technical admins
  • usernames of followers
    • used to show on your profile, can be hidden in user settings
    • the public (if shown) and technical admins
  • usernames of users you follow
    • used to show on your profile, can be hidden in user settings
    • the public (if shown) and technical admins
  • public posts
    • used to show on your profile
    • the public, moderators, and technical admins
  • unlisted posts
    • used to show on your profile but excluded from explore/discovery
    • the public, moderators, and technical admins
  • followers only posts
    • used to show to your followers, stored in this server and the servers of your followers
    • your followers, moderators (local and on remote servers), and technical admins(local and remote)
  • mentioned users only posts
    • used to show to the users mentioned, stored in this server and the servers of the users mentioned
    • the users mentioned, moderators (local and on remote servers), and technical admins(local and remote)
Short: This server hopes to build a respectful community, with a diverse group of people: inclusive of the LGBTQIA+ community; and standing up for POC, trans, and other marginalized communities.

Description:
Welcome!

inductive.space is a tiny Mastodon server for me and friendly people who like programming languages, free software, urbanism or just want to hang out.

It's run by me, Eisfunke. This is very much not a professional operation, but rather a hobby project running from my homeserver. I try my best, I do know my way around server stuff, I keep off-site backups et cetera, but still, please adjust your expectations.

Software

inductive.space runs glitch-soc, which is a fork of of Mastodon's development version with some additional features, such as Markdown posting and more. It can potentially be a little less stable than "normal" Mastodon, so bear with us if something breaks (hasn't happened so far). We also have a higher post length limit of 2520 characters.

This instance follow various other instances and hashtags via relay.fedi.buzz fitting to the instance focus topics listed below. This means the federated timeline you'll see here will contain a lot of stuff from these topics.

The instance runs on NixOS and is configured via NixOS. The configuration running on my server is public and FOSS, you can take a look at it on my GitLab.

Please read the rules

If you want to join, please read and follow the rules below. The Berlin Code of Conduct applies here. I'm committed to make this a friendly, cozy and inductive space for all kinds of people.

Is this the instance for me?

It might be! This is a very small and not a professional server mainly geared to my own usage, and you should consider the downsides of that.

Being small also has upsides though, e.g. we can easily keep a low profile and stay out of fediverse drama. Also, our federated feed is curated (see above) to the server focus topics (see below). It's also more personal â€“ ideally, I want this server to feel like a digital living room to have fun in. It's probably not well suited as a professional forum or something like that.

This might be a good instance for you if you're interested in any of the following:

  • programming languages, types, (theoretical) computer science (as you might have guessed from the domain)
  • free software
  • any kind of science or tech in general
  • urban planning, urbanism, bikes, criticism of car-centric design, maps, OpenStreetMap
  • politics, sociology: from digital privacy over capitalism-critical economics and critical theory to feminism
  • books, podcasts
  • travelling, hiking
  • the people already here

This is probably not a good instance for you if you're politcally conservative, libertarian or right-wing, if you strongly dislike any of the above or if you just want to fight with people who like any of the above.

If I think your posts don't fit well into the instance's community and culture I might ask for you to look for an instance that fits you better, even if you don't explicitly break any rules.

If all that stuff hasn't put you off, and you'd like to participate, feel free to send a join request!

Fediblock Policy

I'm keeping up with the tier 0 blocklist from the oliphant.social blocklists. That keeps out the baseline of Nazi instances and similar stuff.

Apart from that, I mostly only block (a.k. suspend or defederate) instances if they cause problems. Part of the luxury of being a small instance with few people with similar interests is that we're only really interacting with a focused slice of fedi anyway. If you need a sturdier blocklist or an instance in a more curated slice of fedi, you're probably better off on another server.

Disclaimer

This instance is still quite new, and I'm new to the business of running a Mastodon instance, so please bear with me. I'm open to feedback, constructive criticism and suggestions regarding the instance and the rules.

However, please remember that this isn't a democracy in the end, rule interpretation and final decisions will be done by me. The great thing about the fediverse is that if you disagree with my decisions, you can always look for an instance you'd be happier on.

Custom Emoji

  • Neofox by Volpeon (license: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0)

Small public server hosted on a home system, leftist lgbtqia admin. No tolerance for intolerance.

Open registration (check your spam for registration emails), wide array of addons enabled (if you want one I haven't enabled, just let me know).

Got questions? Hit me up at shiri[at]foggyminds.com or on Matrix at @shiri:beeper.com

Der FoodHub MÃ¼nchen wurde am 8.7.2021 in der Deisenhofener Str. 40 in Obergiesing erÃ¶ffnet. Von Montag bis Samstag kannst Du als Mitglied zwischen 8 und 20 Uhr ausgewÃ¤hlte faire, frische, regionale und Ã¼berwiegend biologische Lebensmittel kaufen.

Mit Produkten direkt von teilnehmenden HÃ¶fen und Lebensmittelhandwerker*innen sind wir nachhaltig und gerecht. FÃ¼r eine lebenswerte Welt heute und morgen.

Bio, Saisonal, Lokal & Gemeinsam!

Dieser Server ist nur fÃ¼r Mitglieder von Foodhub MÃ¼nchen und Mitgliedschaft ist nur auf Einladung mÃ¶glich. Bitte wendet Euch an die Admins mit Eurem Foodhub MÃ¼nchen Mattermost-Account.

Clarification of use of posts from this server (2023-07-31)

You can read, respond, boosts, and perform any such activity as done on the Fediverse on posts/toots from this server.

However: any commercial use, regardless of whether you want to sell any content or whether you want to offer any service in which posts from this server are involved are STRICTLY FORBIDDEN. You may not, directly or indirectly, base your commercial business partly or wholly on the use of any post/toot, media, or data from this server.

Please note: all data on this server is covered by German Laws and especially the copyright is based on German "Urheberrechtsgesetz": this means, there is no "irrevocable right to use"! German "Urheberrechtsgesetz" doesn't know or accept "irrevocable". There is no such thing in German Law. The original creator can revoke such permission any time they deem you are misusing their content.

Also: if you receive consent from one user on this server to peruse one of their posts for commercial purposes, THIS DOES NOT MEAN ALL USERS AND/OR ALL POSTS. Consent is required for any commercial use of any data from this server for each data item separately.

Lastly: any scraping of content of any type from this server is strictly prohibited. You are only permitted to use content from this server for "Standard Fediverse Activities", such as reading, replying, starring, bookmarking, etc. Any copying of content from this server outside of "Standard Fediverse Activity" is strictly prohibited. And if you are unsure whether your intended use is "Standard Fediverse Activity", then it probably is NOT.

Crawling the content of the instance and creating a database of its posts and content for the purposes of archiving, searching, or analyzing is strictly prohibited.

And just to be clear: the admin of this server will never tolerate any misuse or unlicensed use of content/data from this server!

Description: Instance for fluffy dragons

ABOUT US

Welcome to a Fediverse Foundation Mastodon Server!
You can find out more about our non-profit association here: fediverse.foundation

OUR RULESET

You can find the set of rules a little further down in the "Server Rules" tab or directly in our wiki in the area of the server rules of our instances (de/en).

No AI / ML clause

It is prohibited to use any data or content from the instances listen below for training of or developing any artificial intelligence or machine learning model without obtaining explicit consent from the copyright owner. Any unauthorized use of data or content for AI/ML purposes will be considered a violation of copyright laws and may result in legal action.

Moderated languages

Regardless of political orientation, our moderators try to moderate all posts equally and objectively in accordance with our server rules. Of course, this is only possible for languages that we understand - therefore only German and English are possible as languages on our instances. In case of doubt, we reserve the right to restrict or delete messages in other languages.

DATA PROTECTION

Please also refer to our wiki for our disclosure regarding data protection in the privacy policy section (de/en).

Federation with Meta (Facebook) / Instagram

Our servers have preemptively blocked federation with threads.net. This rule might be changed in the future, when we know how threads.net implements federation via ActivityPub and how they act on reports coming from the Fediverse.

TECHNICAL AND ORGANIZATIONAL MEASURES

The Fediverse Foundation offers are run as a non-profit association and in our free time. We do not generate any income with the offer and finance ourselves from donations and our own funds. We reserve the right to restrict or terminate the service at any time for legal, technical or financial reasons.

Otherwise the following applies:

  • This server adheres to the agreements for Mastodon server operators: Server Covenant
  • You can also find our technical and organizational measures in our wiki in the area of technical and organizational measures (de/en).

DONATIONS & TRANSPARENCY

We provide the services of the Fediverse Foundation free of advertising and tracking on a voluntary basis in our free time. We offer our services to all users free of charge. If you would like to support us, you can do so in the form of a voluntary donation. The money primarily covers domain, server, electricity and hardware costs.<

MODERATION & ORGANIZATION

  • @PaulaToThePeople
  • General questions: support@fediverse.foundation

TECHNICAL ADMINISTRATION

  • @fossie
  • @b2c

Sources

  • BirdUI theme from https://mementomori.social/@rolle
  • TangerineUI theme from https://https://nileane.fr/@nileane

IMPRINT

Fediverse Foundation
Sillerplatz 8
1130 Vienna
Austria
ZVR: 1121443789
Email: support@fediverse.foundation

Welcome

Arabi.gay is a mastodon server for Arabs, people from the SWANA region or Arabic speakers (including all dialects) who are LGBTQIA+. Anyone is welcome to join (18+).

You can share whatever you feel like or comfortable with sharing with the fediverse in any language or dialect as long as it follows the server rules. Whether you want to talk about tech, politics, food, or even share thirst traps that is all welcome.

Please share why you'd like to join when signing up.

Description:
Anarres is the moon of Urras inhabited by Anarresti who defected to the desert-climate moon almost two centuries ago, shepherded there by their leader Odo, who envisioned an anarcho-syndicalist society free of the constraints of capitalism.

This server is for all those rebels, misfits, round pegs in square holes who want a better server by working together in an anarcho-syndicalist style to manage this instance.

It is funded by the admin, hosted in Europe and thus covered by all European Laws & Regulations, specifically also of Germany.

But please read the rules, especially rule #8 before asking for an account here.

If you would like an account here, please contact any of the members/moderators. Since all members are also moderators, you can get in touch with any member here.

Clarification of use of posts from this server (2023-07-31)

You can read, respond, boosts, and perform any such activity as done on the Fediverse on posts/toots from this server.

However: any commercial use, regardless of whether you want to sell any content or whether you want to offer any service in which posts from this server are involved are STRICTLY FORBIDDEN. You may not, directly or indirectly, base your commercial business partly or wholly on the use of any post/toot, media, or data from this server.

Please note: all data on this server is covered by German Laws and especially the copyright is based on German "Urheberrechtsgesetz": this means, there is no "irrevocable right to use"! German "Urheberrechtsgesetz" doesn't know or accept "irrevocable". There is no such thing in German Law. The original creator can revoke such permission any time they deem you are misusing their content.

Also: if you receive consent from one user on this server to peruse one of their posts for commercial purposes, THIS DOES NOT MEAN ALL USERS AND/OR ALL POSTS. Consent is required for any commercial use of any data from this server for each data item separately.

Lastly: any scraping of content of any type from this server is strictly prohibited. You are only permitted to use content from this server for "Standard Fediverse Activities", such as reading, replying, starring, bookmarking, etc. Any copying of content from this server outside of "Standard Fediverse Activity" is strictly prohibited. And if you are unsure whether your intended use is "Standard Fediverse Activity", then it probably is NOT.

Crawling the content of the instance and creating a database of its posts and content for the purposes of archiving, searching, or analyzing is strictly prohibited.

And just to be clear: the admin of this server will never tolerate any misuse or unlicensed use of content/data from this server!

Emojis used on this server

Blobcat (CC0 license) by various artists

Blobfox (Apache License 2.0) by Volpeon

Blobhaj (CC BY-SA 4.0) by HeatherHorns

Neocat (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 license) by Volpeon

Neofox (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 license) by Volpeon

Neobread (CC BY-NC-SA license) by olyvvybee

drgn (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 license) by Volpeon

Pride Butterflies (CC0 license) by FrazzledBrynn

Queercat (CC0) by ZoeBijl

Infinity Pride (CC-NC-SA license) by Rick Osborne

CAT IS BLOB (CC0) by Elke

SeviCat ([1]) by Sevi

Sora (Red Panda) ([1]) by Sora

[1] Specific permission for use on a per server basis for their users. With each being required to purchase.
Short: This server is for Anarresti only, i.e. for rebels, misfits, round pegs in square holes. It is run in an anarcho-syndicalist style. Membership on invitation only.

Instance information

Run by @sophie along with all the other stuff at catgirl.cloud.

Rules for clarification

Ads and spam are prohibited in any case. German Law applies to everything on this instance, so content prohibited under German Law is prohibited on this instance as well. The line will be drawn at the admin's sole discretion.

  • this instance uses mutant standard emoji

Just as it sounds, its Just Another Socal Network using Mastodon to help build a bigger and brighter community. Enjoy!

Description:
A digital tree in a federated garden. A calm, welcoming place to talk about pretty much anything, but especially interested in technology, music, and films/TV.

What do I do here? Orchard is a Mastodon instance. Mastodon is a federated platform for microblogging.

What's federation? Federation refers to the platform's ability to communicate with other servers and platforms through a shared protocol, in this case ActivityPub. Basically, imagine a world where all of your social media apps were interconnected, and you could get content on your platform from a different one.

What tools do I have to protect myself from harassment? We want to make Orchard feel like a safe place to be. At least, relatively safe, in a social media context. If someone slips past Orchard's moderation, you have a range of tools to combat trolls and harassment on the platform. To stop seeing posts from someone, you have the ability to filter them, mute them, or block them completely. To limit the ability for you to be targeted, you have the options of opting out of discovery, hiding your social graph, or making your profile private. For each post, you can also change the visibility. You're also encouraged to report any bad actors to us.


Server Specs
Hetzner CAX41, Falkenstein
- 16 vCPUs Ampere Altra
- 32GB DDR4 ECC Memory
- 320GB NVMe SSD Storage
BuyVM Block Storage (Media)
- 512GB HDD behind NVMe SSD buffer
Short: A digital tree in a federated garden. A calm, welcoming place to talk about pretty much anything, but especially interested in technology, music, and films/TV.

Description:
OnBoard follows the evolution of board diversity from Patricia Roberts Harris in 1971 to the present day, as seen through the eyes of Black women who are making a positive difference in global corporate spaces.

This online community celebrates the film and the inspirational real-life stories behind it. We invite you to join in the conversation.
Short: #OnBoardTheFilm follows the evolution of board diversity from 1971 to present day as seen through the eyes of Black women. This is a space for the community that's formed around the film.

tuebingen.network ist eine Mastodon-Instanz fÃ¼r alle aus TÃ¼bingen und Umgebung. Betrieben und Moderiert vom Chaostreff TÃ¼bingen (www.cttue.de), meldet euch bei Fragen & Anregungen gerne bei uns.

Regeln/Rules

(hier nur nochmals auf english aufgefÃ¼hrt, die deutschen Regeln sind unter dem Reiter Server Regeln/Server Rules einzusehen)

Since "Be excellent to each other" is much easier said than done, we have a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, and silencing or suspension of accounts, if problems persist. In particular, we do not tolerate:

  • Obviously: no content that is illegal in Germany, no actions intended to damage this instance (performance, reputation, security).
  • Harrassment, stalking, doxxing
  • Racism, sexism, verbal abuse or advocation thereof
  • Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
  • Violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  • Contacting people who made clear they want no contact. Dogpiling/brigading
  • Untagged advertisement
  • Untagged, or automated, or excessive advertisement
  • sexual content or gore
  • No automated accounts (unless approved by the moderators). This includes bots, crossposters, feedposters etc.

Impressum

Chaostreff TÃ¼bingen
WÃ¶hrdstraÃŸe 25
72072 TÃ¼bingen (GERMANY)

Description:
ğŸª¦ WELCOME TO SHADOW'S REST ğŸª¦

ğŸ•¸ï¸ Please find an empty mausoleum, a dusty corner of a crypt, or a threadbare blanket under the looming oak, and make yourself at home. One of our reanimated will be along shortly with a Welcome Urn packed with delightful treats.

ğŸ¦‡ Our library of dusty tomes is extensive, and our Alchemical Alcove beyond reproach. Head to the Slumbering Stone if you need a nap in one of the cushion-stuffed alcoves, or pop into Bitterbones Inn for hushed whispers over bubbling brews.

ğŸˆâ€â¬› Claiming a plot in Shadow's Rest requires being cordially invited by the Shadow Figure. If you are known to the Shadow Figure, please send inquisitive tendrils through the whispy void to require of available plot space.

ğŸ–¤ RULES OF THE GROUND ğŸ–¤

If you are here, it's because I know and trust you, and we share the same values and principles. However, in conjunction with the rules outlined below, for the sake of clarity, and for those peering through the bars of our rusted wrought-iron gate:

  • No microagressions, trolling, harassment, block evasion, abuse, or setting your skeletal army on a rampage.
  • No hate speech, bigotry (racism, colourism, sexism, queermisia, ableism, xenophobia, antisemitism), or judging another inhabitant's connection to the Underworld.
  • Respect your cryptneighbours' boundaries. Be respectful and sincerely apologize if someone informs you that a boundary has been crossed. Give people space if you accidentally push past a boundary.
  • Though denizens of Shadow's Rest all share a connection to the macabre, please tag sensitive content such as violence/blood, graphic nudity, lewd content, and other potentially upsetting or triggering topics and hide them under a Content Warning (CW).
  • No advertising, spam, unapproved bots, or Automated Arisen Cryptknockers.
  • No Cryptocurrency, NFTs, AI-generated content, or Scam Ghouls.

ğŸ¥€ Ultimately, moderation is at the Shadow Figure's discretion and handled on a case-by-case basis regardless of whether any of the rules above have been specifically broken.

ğŸº That said, I would like to run this instance somewhat democratically where all inhabitants of Shadow's Rest have input on how our grounds are maintained.

ğŸ¦‰ FRIENDS OF THE REST ğŸ¦‰

Shadow's Rest allows visitors at our discretion, and prohibits entry to any instance that contravenes our core rules or that we just don't vibe with.

Our instance blocklist is copied from mastodon.art, with some extra additions to keep our space small and cozy.
Short: Shadow's Rest is a cozy space for lovers of gothic vibes and wholesome necromancy, run by WelshPixie.

Description:
This is a radical left (Marxist-Leninist/anarcho-communist/adjacent) server, with emphasis on leftist inter-tendency discussion, and de-facto obligatory furry discourse.

Folks popping into this instance might be confused by some of the extreme positions that much of our community holds. They might consider defederation. That's fine, and RPC members should be aware that this will happen.

But if you want to try to figure out why we have good things to say about Stalin, or have the flag of the Workers Party of Korea as an emoji, or unabashedly support organized violence against the capitalist class, you can talk to me.

Funding

I (Comrade Ferret) am paying for this server myself. But if you like it, or you like the other things I do, you can send me a buck or two at http://www.ko-fi.com/comradeferret

Discord

RPC originated as a Discord server. We have active discussions, democratic server decisionmaking, a leftist theory book club, weekly movie nights, and fluff.

https://discord.gg/HgbpXMZPR4
Short: This is a radical left (Marxist-Leninist/anarcho-communist/adjacent) server, with emphasis on leftist inter-tendency discussion, and de-facto obligatory furry discourse.

The plan is just inviting friends who donâ€™t currently use mastodon to this instance and move away from more traditional social media. There is no specific focus on this instance its more for fun.
